meanings.definition: A sequence of four letters or symbols.
meanings.sent1: In the ancient text, they discovered mysterious tetragrams that held hidden meanings.
meanings.sent2: The cryptographer decoded the message using the series of tetragrams provided.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a note with strange tetragrams, trying to decipher its secret code.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a puzzle with scattered tetragrams waiting to be pieced together.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful tetragrams to help the students learn the alphabet.

meanings.definition: A set of four musical notes.
meanings.sent1: The composer's melody was based on a beautiful arrangement of tetragrams.
meanings.sent2: The choir harmonized perfectly, each member singing a different tetragram.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to chirp in tetragrams, creating a melodious symphony.
meanings.sent4: The music flowed like a river, each note a distinct tetragram in the score.
meanings.sent5: The pianist played a complex piece filled with intricate tetragrams.

meanings.definition: A group of four elements or items.
meanings.sent1: The tetragrams of spices in the recipe gave the dish its unique flavor.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together, each member representing a different tetragram of skills.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game where they had to collect tetragrams of colored blocks.
meanings.sent4: The four friends formed a strong bond, each one an essential tetragram of the group.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle required fitting the tetragrams of pieces together to reveal the picture.
